faqs.question: What is the typical price range for a 3 BHK flat in Sector 34 Rohtak
faqs.answer: The price range for a 3 BHK flat in Sector 34 Rohtak varies based significantly on the specific society, the age of the construction, and the overall size or carpet area of the unit. Generally, a mid-range 3 BHK flat can start from approximately INR 45 lakhs and go upwards to INR 75 lakhs or more for premium, newly constructed properties with high-end amenities, like modular kitchens, centralized security, and dedicated power backup. It is essential to look at the exact square footage and the list of included amenities to determine the true value.

faqs.question: Are the flats in Sector 34 ready to move or primarily under construction projects
faqs.answer: Sector 34 Rohtak offers a balanced portfolio of both ready-to-move-in flats and ongoing under-construction projects. Many established housing societies have completed their phases, offering immediate possession and allowing buyers to evaluate the property quality firsthand. Simultaneously, several new phases and entirely new builder projects are underway, which often allows buyers to benefit from lower launch prices and customized payment plans. We recommend checking the specific status of the listing you are interested in.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits of buying a resale flat versus a new flat in this sector
faqs.answer: Buying a resale flat in Sector 34 often means gaining immediate possession, avoiding the risks associated with construction delays, and enjoying lower registration costs based on the depreciated value. Resale properties usually have established maintenance systems and communities. Conversely, new flats offer modern designs, sometimes better energy efficiency, builder warranties, and the ability to choose finishes. New flats also typically align better with Vastu principles if they are newly designed according to current standards.

faqs.question: What kind of amenities can I expect in gated flat societies in Sector 34
faqs.answer: Gated societies offering flats in Sector 34 Rohtak are known for providing extensive lifestyle amenities. Standard features include 24-hour security and surveillance, dedicated car parking, 100% power backup for common areas, and high-speed lifts. Premium societies often offer additional features like clubhouses, swimming pools, fully equipped gymnasiums, children's play areas, jogging tracks, and multi-purpose community halls. Many also include manicured gardens and dedicated security personnel.

faqs.question: Is Sector 34 a good area for rental investment and what are the yields like
faqs.answer: Yes, Sector 34 is considered an excellent area for rental investment. Its strategic location near the national highway and institutional areas drives high rental demand, particularly for 2 BHK and 3 BHK units. faqs.question: How close is Sector 34 Rohtak to the main city center and railway station
faqs.answer: Sector 34 Rohtak is strategically located slightly away from the extreme congestion of the old city center, offering a peaceful environment, but remains highly accessible. It is typically a 15 to 20 minute drive to the main Rohtak City Center and the Rohtak Junction Railway Station, depending on the time of day and traffic conditions. Excellent road connectivity via wide sector roads ensures this commute is relatively smooth and quick.

faqs.question: Are the properties in Sector 34 RERA approved and legally clear
faqs.answer: When purchasing newly launched or under-construction flats, it is crucial to ensure they are RERA registered. Reputable developers in Sector 34 strictly adhere to RERA guidelines, ensuring transparency and timely project completion. For resale flats, all relevant title deeds and occupancy certificates must be verified by a legal expert. Our platform only lists properties with clear legal standing, and we always advise clients to conduct thorough due diligence.

faqs.question: What documents are required to secure a home loan for a flat in Sector 34
faqs.answer: To secure a home loan for a flat in Sector 34 Rohtak, you will typically need several documents including proof of identity and address, proof of income such as salary slips or tax returns for the last two to three years, bank statements, and the property documents itself. The property documents include the sale agreement, allocation letter, and the No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the society. Financial institutions may request additional paperwork depending on the borrower's profile.

faqs.question: What are the typical maintenance charges for flats in Sector 34 societies
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges vary significantly across different societies in Sector 34, depending on the level of luxury and the number of amenities provided. Generally, maintenance fees are calculated based on the Super Built-Up Area (SBA) of the flat. You can expect typical charges to range from INR 2 to INR 4 per square foot per month. These charges usually cover security, common area electricity, lift maintenance, garbage disposal, and upkeep of gardens and pools.

faqs.question: Does Sector 34 have good public transport connectivity options

The planned expansion of local transport routes aims to further improve accessibility, ensuring residents can travel conveniently across the city without reliance on private vehicles.
